title: Aug 4th Pub Crawl
name: Aug 4th Pub Crawl
description:
A Map by Onixxxxxxxx

All the hip and cool rad places we plan to hit on Friday.  We'll see.

properties.name: Beauty Bar
properties.description: Posted by Onixxxxxxxx1638 N Cahuenga Blvd Hollywood, CA 90028 Decked out like a beauty parlor from the 1960s, this elegantly kitsch bar serves up martinis with your manicure (Thu-Sat 6pm-11pm) for only 0. Owner Paul Devitt, who also owns Star Shoes around the corner, paid homage to vintage glamour by outfitting this retro salon with salvaged fixtures from a salon in Bakersfield. The bar serves up clever drinks like the Prell, made with Midori, pineapple and vodka, and the Platinum Blonde, which has vodka, Malibu rum and pineapple. The vintage blow-dryers are great to sit under while gossiping over cosmos in the early evening. But if you stay late enough on Thursdays, you\'re likely spot indie hot shots like Har Mar Superstar, Nick Zinner from The Yeah Yeah Yeahs or Carlos D. from Interpol manning the turntables. This explains all those hip indie guys standing in such close proximity to the blow-dryers!—Lonny Pugh

properties.name: Bigfoot Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Onixxxxxxxx3172 los feliz blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039-1507Decorated with references to the Pacific Northwest and Sasquatch, this log cabin of a cocktail lounge is for kitsch-loving cads and kittens who want to warm up by the fireplace. Looking straight out of a vintage postcard from a Redwood Highway vacation, the Bigfoot Lodge is watched over by Smokey the Bear, or a reasonable facsimile thereof. The "Twin Peaks" feeling carries over to the drink menu, which includes selections like the minty Girl Scout cookie, the flaming toasted marshmallow and the mighty Sasquatch (served in a very tall glass, of course). The kitschy cool vibe is exceeded only by the resident DJs, who add to the atmosphere by spinning unpredictable sequences of vintage vinyl selections. Doors open at 5pm on Mondays for Karaoke and on Tuesdays, kitsch-loving girls crowd out the indie-rock boys for Girls\' Night Out and pink drinks; Wednesdays belong to London Calling with DJ Lee on decks spinning punk, \'80s, glam, mod, freak beat, goth, Brit pop and modern garage; Hee Haw Hell takes over on Thursdays cheap brews ( Pabst Blue Ribbons, to be exact) and sleazy rockabilly, punk and garage music; and on Sundays "Spencer the Movie Guy" shows wacky 16mm and 8mm archived films. Tip: Drinks are off from 5pm to 8pm daily. Tuesday is "Girls\' Night Out" with pink drinks and tap beer for the ladies. Thursdays offer PBRs and whiskey "buck shots." Atmosphere: Hip Celebrity Factor: We spotted Morrissey hanging out in a booth with five girls. Parking: Street -la.com

properties.name: Burgundy Room
properties.description: Posted by Onixxxxxxxx1621 1/2 Cahuenga Blvd Hollywood CA 90028-6201mudged mirrors, shaky ceiling fans, sticky floors, a dinged-up tabletop bar and hanging red Chinese lanterns give the narrow interior of this dive bar a Vietnam-era G.I. look—while the tattooed Sid and Nancy-type crowd and punk-rock aesthetic give it a CBGB’s vibe. The infamous jukebox features the Sex Pistols, the Ramones and Johnny Cash. Play "Ring of Fire" and the bartenders have been known to light the length of the bar on fire in tribute. A typical night here will include glass getting broken, random makeout sessions and lots of liquored-up patrons stumbling out the door. The tattooed and pierced crowd might seem intimidating, but can be quite friendly. If, that is, you happen look like one of them. —Patrick Green Atmosphere: Artsy Celebrity Factor: Johnny Knoxville, Bam Margera, Steve-O and the rest of the former "Jackass" crew used to make this a regular haunt. They still occasionally drop in when in town. Parking: Street parking, nearby lots -la.com

properties.name: Colorado Bar
properties.description: Posted by Onixxxxxxxx2640 E Colorado Blvd Pasadena, CA 91107-3726 We all know what the Colorado is about: cheap ass drinks, gross bathrooms and smoking inside. This is a place where the owner will tell your date dirty sex jokes and the boncer will call you overdressed in anything but a teeshirt. Sawdust atmosphere and gutter trash humor have their home here, and that\'s why we love it so.

properties.name: Convenient Parking
properties.description: Posted by OnixxxxxxxxHollywood Blvd and Argyle Ave, Hollywood CAconvenient lot parking within striking distance of the well / daddy\'s + the cahuenga corridor. its like 8 buck or something - just pony up and pay it, you\'re in a car with a bunch of folks anyways and it beats spending precious minutes that could be used to nurse a domestic instead of hawking for a spot.

properties.name: Daddy's Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Onixxxxxxxx1610 N Vine St Hollywood, CA 90028ne of the dimmest bars in Hollywood, this spot has been a fave with hipsters and hellraisers ever since it took over Lucky Seven several years ago. Too low-lit to serve as a pick-up joint and too clustered seating-wise to be a networking nest, this one\'s best for lounging with a group of pals or cozying up in a cushy booth with a hot weeknight date. On the weekends the booths fill quickly with a motley crowd—greasers, indie rockers and some tinseltown trendoids—commanding, and not leaving, most sections of the bar. Either way, it\'s all about soaking in the atmosphere of the various crowds that converge here, a vibe that is enhanced by the bar\'s mixed-up jukebox spewing the Rolling Stones, Aretha Franklin, Guns \'n Roses and Outkast. As the drinks flow and the music pumps up, it can get downright bustling in here: It may be dark, but it\'s never dreary. Cost: No cover. Drinks cost -3. Atmosphere: Edgy Parking: Lot, street -la.com

properties.name: Good Luck Bar
properties.description: Posted by Onixxxxxxxx1514 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027-5516 Looking for something a little more exotic than your regular neighborhood bar? Good luck. The décor here falls somewhere between a Chinese opium den and a trendy antique sale. Ornate paper lanterns and carved dragons hover over a hip and sexy crowd of Eastside singles. The adventurous try the house drink, The Good Luck; those feeling especially lucky loll in a cozy back room with lounge chairs. Cost: No cover Atmosphere: Hip Parking: Lot, street -la.com

properties.name: Lucky Baldwin's Pub
properties.description: Posted by Onixxxxxxxx17 S Raymond Ave Pasadena, CA 91105-1913 "Think globally, drink locally" is the motto of this affable Pasadena pub named after E.J. "Lucky" Baldwin, the founder of the Santa Anita racetrack. In this case, "globally" means the U.K., so expect exposed brick, "Lovely day for a Guinness" posters and soccer hooligans on the telly. Enjoy a game of darts in the upstairs loft, tuck into crispy fish and chips or have a smoke on the patio permanently strewn with Christmas lights. Special events run the gamut from Sunday keg parties to the occasional live band. The Draw A mild-mannered mix of students, yuppies, retirees and everyone else who delights in hoisting a pint. Draught beers are the usual suspects, with one local exception: Pasadena\'s own Craftsman Ale. Those with more eclectic tastes can choose from the vast array of Belgian ales and fruit lambics. rowded: yes Trendy: yes Romantic: no Good for after work: yes Good dancing: no Good social scene: yes Good happy hour: yes -citysearch.com

properties.name: Red Lion Tavern
properties.description: Posted by Onixxxxxxxx2366 Glendale Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039-3209

properties.name: The Well
properties.description: Posted by Onixxxxxxxx6255 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles CANightlife nepotism isn\'t what made this watering hole a local favorite, although it does have a famous Hollywood daddy. Although it does get some overflow from Daddy\'s, its bar brethren around the corner, this more mature and sleek lounge has developed a name for itself on its own. It\'s more about laid-back conversation than attempted hookups. The dimly lit, tan-and-dark-brown decor is stylish yet simple: Cushy booths, benches and oversized ottomans surround a rectangular bar that serves as a centerpiece to the cozy one-room interior. The regulars, often clad in retro rock T-shirts and leather jackets, seem more interested in the eclectic jukebox (it has everything from A Tribe Called Quest to Johnny Cash) and the sexy, stiff-pouring bartenders than making new friends or finding new lovers. And in Hollywood, that\'s a rare thing indeed. On weekends, expect long lines out the door. Tip: It\'s the perfect pre-party place to grab a quick drink and bite before attending a concert at the Palladium across the street. Drinks are discounted weekdays 5pm-9pm. Cost: No cover. Drinks cost -2, but they\'re strong. Atmosphere: Hip Parking: Valet Thurs, Fri, Sat only -la.com
